segments.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing here, it's like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and the woman doesn't even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of dread washing over me as I watch the puddle grow larger and larger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids, they're so focused on those cookies that they don't see the danger either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool like it's the most natural thing in the world, but it's clearly about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout out a warning, to make them all stop and pay attention to what's really important.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I know they can't hear me, so I'm just left feeling helpless and anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't tear my eyes away from the scene, even though it's making me more and more nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope that somehow, someway, they all realize the danger before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just too much for me to handle, I need to look away.
segments.speaker: PAR
